meanings.definition: Shiny and smooth in texture, appearance, or finish.
meanings.sent1: The polished mirror reflected the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent2: She wore a polished necklace that sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent3: The polished floors were so shiny, they looked like a giant mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her polished nails gleamed like precious gems.
meanings.sent5: The polished gemstone was so smooth to the touch.

meanings.definition: To make something smooth and shiny by rubbing or chemical action.
meanings.sent1: She polished the silverware until it gleamed.
meanings.sent2: He polished his shoes before the job interview.
meanings.sent3: The knight polished his armor until it shone like the sun.
meanings.sent4: She polished the car until it looked brand new.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler polished the diamond to perfection.

meanings.definition: To improve or refine something, such as a skill or performance.
meanings.sent1: He polished his presentation skills by practicing in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent2: She polished her essay until it was the best in the class.
meanings.sent3: The chef polished his recipe until it became a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: They polished their dance routine until it was flawless.
meanings.sent5: The artist polished his technique to create stunning paintings.
